intro: Duvaliandra dioscoridis, commonly known as the Cape snowflake, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers that resemble snowflakes. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal regions. It has small, trifoliate leaves and produces legume-like pods that contain its seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun.
